title: Garante Privacy Guidelines on AI and Data Protection

paragraphs.text: Processing within AI systems must rely on a GDPR-compliant legal basis and be recorded in governance registers.
Purposes for training, validation and deployment must remain compatible with the original collection context.
Requires layered notices describing automated logic, significance and consequences for data subjects.
Mandates informing individuals about conversational agents and biometric or emotion recognition tools.
Organisations must maintain registers covering AI use cases, data flows, DPIA outcomes and mitigation measures.
Safeguards must be proportionate to the scale and sensitivity of processing.
Requires trained human reviewers capable of intervening and overriding AI outputs.
Mandates periodic audits, scenario testing and escalation to the data protection officer.
High-risk AI deployments must be notified to the Garante together with DPIAs and mitigation plans.
Controllers must cooperate with authorities, sharing incident information and remedial actions.
